title: Staff
text:
The Center for Systems Change and Social Norms Research in Public Health is supported by a committed team advancing systems transformation, equity, and community-centered public health practice. Our staff bring diverse expertise in research, policy, evaluation, and social norms work.







Executive Director


Dr.Â Tura is a public health executive, researcher, and equity champion whose work centers on transforming public health systems through research, policy, and community partnership.


Email: robsan.tura@crscph.org

title: Publications
text:
The Center for Systems Change and Social Norms Research in Public Health produces research, reports, and evidence designed to strengthen public health systems and advance equity. Our work spans social norms research, systems analysis, evaluation, and community-engaged public health inquiry.
Below is a selection of publications, reports, briefs, and presentations from our team and collaborators. This page will grow as more work becomes available.



Add your published articles here.
For each article, use this format:
Author(s) (Year). Title of Article. Journal Name, Volume(Issue), pages.
Link to article
Example:
Tura, R., & colleagues (2024). Systems Change Approaches to Advancing Health Equity in Public Health Practice. Journal of Public Health Systems, 18(2), 45â€“59.
Read article â†’




Use this section to share center-led reports, evaluations, and findings.
Example:
Center for Systems Change and Social Norms Research in Public Health (2025). Understanding Social Norms and Systems Drivers of Maternal Health Inequities in Minnesota.
Download report â†’




Short, accessible summaries designed for policymakers, agency leaders, and practitioners.
Example:
Policy Brief: Strengthening Public Health Capacity Through Systems Transformation.
View brief â†’




List presentations given at conferences, webinars, and invited talks.
Example:
Tura, R. (2025). Social Norms and Systems Change in Public Health Practice. Presentation at the American Public Health Association (APHA) Annual Me

title: Contact
text:
Thank you for your interest in the Center for Systems Change and Social Norms Research in Public Health. We welcome inquiries, collaboration opportunities, requests for partnership, and questions about our research, services, and initiatives.
We value meaningful, equity-centered relationships and look forward to connecting with you.



For all inquiries, including research questions, partnerships, services, or collaborations, please contact:
Email:
robsan.tura@crscph.org

St.Â Paul, MN 55164

title: About the Center
text:
The Center for Systems Change and Social Norms Research in Public Health is a research and practice hub dedicated to understanding how systems, structures, and social norms shape health outcomesâ€”and how transforming them can advance equity and wellbeing for all communities.
We bring together interdisciplinary research, community partnership, and public health practice to illuminate the forces that influence behavior, culture, and policy across populations.



To strengthen public health systems by generating evidence, tools, and partnerships that shift harmful norms, transform inequitable structures, and support healthier, more inclusive communities.




A world where public health systems are just, responsive, and inclusiveâ€”and where social norms uplift rather than marginalize communities.
A world where health equity is the standard, not the exception.




We believe meaningful and sustainable public health change requires a combined focus on:


Understanding and transforming the policies, structures, and institutional practices that shape health outcomes and inequities.



Examining how cultural expectations, beliefs, and unwritten rules influence behavior, service access, and health equityâ€”especially among marginalized communities.



Centering lived experience, co-design, and community voice in all stages of research and implementation.



Working with communities, agencies, and cross-sector partners to turn research findings into practical solutions, policy improvements, and systems transformation.






Equity: We work to confront structural racism, discrimination, and systems of oppression that drive inequities.

Community Partnership: We prioritize lived experience and collaboration with community members and leaders.

Integrity: We commit to rigorous, transparent, and responsible research and practice.

Innovation: We explore creative, interdisciplinary methods to understand and shift complex systems.

Humility: We recognize that communities are the experts in their experience, and we engage with care, respect, and accountability.






We bridge research and practice, ensuring evidence informs real-world change.

We integrate complex systems thinking with social norms theory.

We prioritize culturally responsive and community-grounded approaches.

We focus on structural drivers of inequity, not just individual behaviors.

We support agencies and organizations seeking to transform how public health is practiced.





Our center collaborates with:

State and local public health agencies

Community organizations and advocacy groups

Academic partners

National research networks

Foundations and policy leaders

These partnerships support systems transformation, policy development, health equity research, and community-led change initiatives.




We welcome partnerships, inquiries, and collaboration opportunities. Visit our Contact page to learn more about how to engage with our center.

title: CRSC-PH
text:
The Center for Systems Change and Social Norms Research in Public Health is dedicated to advancing research and practice that transform the systems, structures, and cultural norms shaping health outcomes. We work at the intersection of public health, social norms, systems science, and health equity, bringing together research, community insight, and policy analysis to support meaningful and sustainable change.
Our logo reflects this missionâ€”demonstrating the interdependence between systems, community, and culture, and the shared responsibility required to improve public health for all.



At the Center, we focus on research and partnerships that:

Examine how social norms influence behaviors, health outcomes, and equity.
Identify and address structural and systems-level drivers of disparities.
Develop tools, frameworks, and evidence that support systems transformation.
Collaborate with communities, government agencies, and cross-sector partners.
Translate research into practice and policy to improve population health.





We ground our work in the belief that public health must be:

Inclusive
Community-informed
Culturally responsive
Accountable to those most impacted by systemic inequities

Our research and partnerships reflect these values, prioritizing lived experience alongside empirical evidence.




Use the navigation menu above to explore:

About â€“ Learn about our mission, values, and approach

Services â€“ Explore our consulting, research, and partnership offerings

Publications â€“ Access reports, manuscripts, and evidence from our work

Contact â€“ Reach out to collaborate or connect with our team

title: Services
text:
The Center for Systems Change and Social Norms Research in Public Health provides research, consultation, and strategic support to partners working to strengthen public health systems and advance health equity. Our services are grounded in evidence, systems science, community partnership, and culturally responsive practice.
We collaborate with government agencies, community organizations, academic institutions, and cross-sector partners to generate insights, build capacity, and support meaningful, sustainable transformation.



We conduct rigorous, equity-centered research to understand how systems and social norms influence behavior, service access, health outcomes, and community resilience. Our research supports:

Public health program evaluation

Social norms and behavior insights

Systems mapping and systems analysis

Community-engaged and participatory methods

Policy analysis and evidence translation

Equity impact assessments





We support agencies and organizations seeking to shift systems, strengthen equity, and improve public health outcomes. Our consultation services include:

Systems transformation strategy

Organizational and structural analysis

Equity and inclusion frameworks

Social norms change strategy development

Public health systems modernization

Cross-sector collaboration and alignment





We provide training that equips teams and leaders with the tools needed to transform public health systems. Our training offerings include:

Systems thinking for public health

Social norms theory and application

Health equity and structural determinants of health

Community engagement and co-design

Data storytelling and evidence communication

Implementation and change management





We collaborate with communities to ensure research and strategies reflect lived experience, cultural context, and community priorities. Our services include:

Co-design and participatory approaches

Community advisory structures

Qualitative and mixed-methods research

Culturally grounded engagement strategies

Narrative and norms-change initiatives





We help partners interpret research, apply evidence, and develop policies that promote equitable outcomes. Our work includes:

Policy analysis and systems impacts

Briefs, reports, and evidence syntheses

Legislative and regulatory insight

Strategic communication and messaging

Health equity policy development





Every system, community, and organization is unique. We offer tailored partnerships to meet specific needs and goals. Connect with us to explore:

Customized research projects

Long-term strategic partnerships

Collaborative grant proposals

Capacity-building cohorts or institutes

Pilot projects and innovation initiatives
